item.title: Studio One Export in Auxy Pro
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
Auxy as it stands is fairly self contained and I don’t see any issue with expanding its integration capabilities to other platforms, even to a “no-name” DAW like Studio One (which, fwiw, has a lot more name brand recognition than Auxy as of right now even if it’s not the most mainstream of DAW choices).

Read full topic

item.title: Studio One Export in Auxy Pro
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Produk:

instead of integration for a no-name DAW

Just because a relatively new DAW is less known to you doesn’t make it no-name. it’s been around for a while and while it doesn’t have the same recognition as Ableton, Logic, FL or ProTools, it is still used by a number of people.

Read full topic

item.title: Studio One Export in Auxy Pro
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah it seemed to work ok, I exported a track @HXGN and imported to Studio One Prime, worked fine. All audio was there, midi was there. I’m not a fan of the UI, not to mention I’m not huge on desktop software, but it worked and all tracks were accounted for.

Read full topic
